6ba643dd1744c0733e5befe047d6025f (08:50): 282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd: do we still have to ask to land big chunk of C++ code (re the windows linker issue)
54e41c406ca8e1a8af656c42c41fba05 (08:50): wishes he could rs 54e41c406ca8e1a8af656c42c41fba05 them, since they're not normally built and are tools only :-)
282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd (08:50): 6ba643dd1744c0733e5befe047d6025f: it's still better, yes
6ba643dd1744c0733e5befe047d6025f (08:54): 282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd: what *big* means?
282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd (08:55): 6ba643dd1744c0733e5befe047d6025f: how big is your stuff?
6ba643dd1744c0733e5befe047d6025f (08:56): 282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd: the directory is 268K (including Makefiles, interfaces and two test files)
282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd (08:57): 6ba643dd1744c0733e5befe047d6025f: that's pretty big, what are you adding?
6ba643dd1744c0733e5befe047d6025f (08:57): 282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd: WebSMS
6ba643dd1744c0733e5befe047d6025f (08:57): I could try to find a way to not build it on Windows if that can help
6ba643dd1744c0733e5befe047d6025f (08:57): but I would prefer to prevent that kind of tricks

282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd (08:59): 6ba643dd1744c0733e5befe047d6025f: you can do that, or you can check on try how much more memory it's going to use compared to m-c. (you need to add export MOZ_PGO=1 in your try mozconfig for windows, and check the vsize info in the log)
6ba643dd1744c0733e5befe047d6025f (08:59): 282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd: where do the mozconfigs live?
282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd (09:01): 6ba643dd1744c0733e5befe047d6025f: iirc mozconfig-extra at topsrcdir
c3173b0c5d01e156c79e946cdf78e771 (09:01): 282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd: 6ba643dd1744c0733e5befe047d6025f: either of you know if we'll be merging inbound->mc before fork tomorrow?
282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd (09:01): c3173b0c5d01e156c79e946cdf78e771: you mean, today? ;) no idea
6ba643dd1744c0733e5befe047d6025f (09:02): I mean, anyone can do the merge so you just have to do it if you need it ;)
282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd (09:02): c3173b0c5d01e156c79e946cdf78e771: note that this doesn't mean much wrt what is going to be in aurora
282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd (09:02): c3173b0c5d01e156c79e946cdf78e771: it's not necessarily the last changeset on m-c that is merged on aurora
282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd (09:02): it could very well be one from two days ago
282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd (09:03): unlikely, but possible
c3173b0c5d01e156c79e946cdf78e771 (09:03): 282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd: well, right.  But landing on m-c increases my chances exponentially!

6ba643dd1744c0733e5befe047d6025f (09:09): 282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd: why the cs can be two days old?
dd83f96fa74f05bcbcf275c4352ab4f4 (09:10): there's no guaranteed cut-off date. you land near the merge at your own risk.
282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd (09:10): 6ba643dd1744c0733e5befe047d6025f: because it can
